evidence.text: Injunction against the US government/official or APA vacatur requested.

extracted.value: On April 3, 2025 the plaintiffs – the American Federation of Government Employees, AFL‑CIO, and affiliated unions – filed a complaint seeking declaratory relief and injunctive relief against the U.S. government’s Executive Order 14251, specifically requesting the court to enjoin the government and vacate the order.

evidence.source_document: Ex Parte Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order and Order to Show Cause
evidence.text: Support of Motion for Temporary Restraining Order and Order to Show Cause; the Declarations listed in the Index of Declarations; the Complaint; and the complete records filed in this case, Plaintiffs American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE), American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, Service Employees International Union (SEIU), National Association of Government Employees, National Federation of Federal Employees, IAM, AFL‑CIO, and National Nurses Organizing Committee/National Nurses United.

evidence.source_document: Ex Parte Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order and Order to Show Cause

extracted.value: On April 7, 2025 the plaintiffs filed an ex‑parte motion for a temporary restraining order and order to show cause, asking the court to enjoin the Department of Transportation from issuing orders excluding subdivisions and to restrain the Secretary of Transportation from issuing related guidance.

evidence.text: MOTION for leave to appear in Pro Hac Vice ( Filing fee $ 328, receipt number ACANDC‑20530308.) filed by American Federation Of Government Employees, AFL‑CIO, National Nurses Organizing Committee/National Nurses United, Service Employees International Union, AFL‑CIO, National Association of Government Employees, Inc., National Federation of Federal Employees, IAM, AFL‑CIO, American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, AFL‑CIO. (Filed on 4/3/2025)

extracted.value: On April 3, 2025 the plaintiffs filed a motion for leave to appear in pro hac vice, requesting the court to allow their counsel to appear as attorneys of record in the case.

evidence.text: plaintiffs filed a motion for a temporary restraining order asking to enjoin defendants from implementing or giving effect to EO 14251. The Court denied a TRO, finding that plaintiffs had not sufficiently established “the immediacy required for a TRO to be issued at this nascent stage..." The Court determined that plaintiffs’ motion for a TRO should instead be treated as a motion for a preliminary injunction.
MOTION for a preliminary injunction request... The Court also received... a brief in support of the preliminary injunction motion filed by amici curiae... (Filed 06/24/25)

extracted.value: On June 24, 2025 the court issued an order re preliminary injunction, denying the plaintiffs’ temporary restraining order request but granting a preliminary injunction that enjoins the implementation of Executive Order 14251.

evidence.text: The government filed emergency motions to stay the preliminary injunction pending appeal in both this court and the district court. On July 7, 2025, we granted the government’s request

extracted.value: On July 7, 2025 the government filed an emergency motion to stay the preliminary injunction pending appeal, requesting the court to postpone the injunction until the appeal is resolved.
